heroDescription: Provo, Utah, is a vibrant city known for its stunning mountain views and a strong tech-driven economy.
landscapeDescription: Provo's economy is bolstered by a growing tech sector and a strong educational presence, particularly from Brigham Young University. The city is also seeing growth in healthcare and retail industries.
uniqueNeeds: Provo's unique needs include affordable housing and support for tech startups.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Provo's tech sector growth poses concentration risks; housing market may face bubble concerns. Prepare for potential natural disasters like flooding and consider diversifying investments.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Provo's economy has grown by 4.5% year-over-year, driven by tech and education sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Provo is approximately $66,000, reflecting a diverse economic base.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Provo are increasingly specializing in tech startups and real estate investments.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Provo's cost of living is 10% lower than the national average, making it attractive for new residents.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Provo's real estate market is competitive, with home prices rising 8% over the past year.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Provo's business climate is favorable, with a growing number of startups and supportive local policies.
